intro: Ilex pulogensis, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its foliage remains evergreen throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant in landscaping. The berries are toxic to humans and animals, so care should be taken when handling or planting this species.
